title: Tracking Issue for `io::Cursor::{remaining_slice, is_empty}`

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

labels.name: A-io
labels.description: Area: std::io, std::fs, std::net and std::path

body:
Feature gate: `#![feature(cursor_remaining)]`

This is a tracking issue for adding <s>`remaining`</s> and `is_empty` to `io::Cursor`.

### Example

```rust
let mut buff = Cursor::new(vec![1, 2, 3, 4, 5]);

buff.set_position(2);
assert_eq!(buff.remaining_slice(), &[3, 4, 5]);

buff.set_position(5);
assert!(buff.is_empty());
```

### Steps / History

- [x] Implementation: #86037
- [ ] Final commenting period (FCP)
- [ ] Stabilization PR

### Unresolved Questions/Issues

- <s>name `remaining` https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/86037#issuecomment-860957880</s>
- <s>change signature of `remaining` to return `usize`. https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/86369#issuecomment-867866381</s>
- <s>conflict with `<Cursor as bytes::Buf>::remaining` https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/86369#issuecomment-867723485</s>
